oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Vince Gill Interview - Biff Collie
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Recording of an interview with Vince Gill (performer), conducted by Biff Collie.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Vince Gill; Biff Collie
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) Vince Gill mentions 'Never Alone' with Rosanne Cash (00:11) Gill and Biff Collie discuss Gill's recording history -- (01:17) Gill speaks about 'Sight for sore eyes' -- (01:40) Gill's radio spot of 'Oh Girl' -- (01:57) Gill speaks about 'Oh Girl' and recording with The Sweethearts of the Rodeo -- (03:20) Gill calls his new song " the theme song of Oklahoma" -- (04:56) Collie and Gill discuss selling a recorded to MCA -- (05:45) Gill speaks of the special position he is in -- (07:30) Collie and Gill speak of his new single [unknown] -- (08:43) Gill discusses playing before Jimmy Dean and the prospect of performing duet album with Patty Loveless -- (10:05) Collie and Gill discuss 'Ridin' the Rodeo' -- (11:20) Gill reflects on early song writing roots -- (12:18) Gill speaks of Eagles and like groups influence on country -- (13:42) 'Never knew Lonely' is discussed by Gill -- (14:55) Gill discusses life on the road and it's effect on family life -- (16:02) Gill speaks of how he met his wife -- (16:55) Gill speaks of Greg Trooper's help on recording -- (17:45) 'We could have been' origins are discussed -- (18:19) Co-writing is discussed -- (20:32) Collie and Gill talks about which songs will become singles -- (21:20) Collie performs sign off
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Collie, Biff; Gill, Vince;
